Agency: Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs

Notes: Description field shows type of discrimination that EEOC had alleged.

Description: Banner Health agreed to pay the United States $6.1 million to settle allegations that the company submitted false claims to Medicare to obtain reimbursement for home health care visits by its Wyoming facilities that were either not reasonable or not necessary.

The Department of Justice reached 70 settlements involving 457 hospitals in 43 states for more than $250 million related to cardiac devices that were implanted in Medicare patients in violation of Medicare coverage requirements.

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Agency: U.S. Attorney-Western District of New York

Description: Banner Health agreed to pay $1 million to settle a lawsuit over its sale of a North Dakota hospital and five nursing homes.
Info Source: Banner Health agrees to $1 million settlement of ND lawsuit, Associated Press, December 15, 2003 (via Nexis).
